title: SHAREHOLDER ALERT: Rigrodsky & Long, P.A. Announces Investigation of AmTrust Financial Services, Inc. Buyout
text:
WILMINGTON, Del.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Rigrodsky & Long, P.A.:
Do you own shares of AmTrust Financial Services, Inc. (NASDAQ GS: AFSI )? Did you purchase any of your shares prior to March 1, 2018? Do you think the proposed buyout is fair? Do you want to discuss your rights?
Rigrodsky & Long, P.A. announces that it is investigating potential legal claims against the board of directors of AmTrust Financial Services, Inc. (“AmTrust” or the “Company”) (NASDAQ GS: AFSI ) regarding possible breaches of fiduciary duties and other violations of law related to the Company’s entry into an agreement to be acquired by Evergreen Parent, L.P., an entity formed by private equity funds managed by Stone Point Capital LLC (“Stone Point”), together with Barry D. Zyskind, Chairman and CEO of AmTrust, George Karfunkel and Leah Karfunkel (collectively, the “Karfunkel-Zyskind Family”) in a transaction valued at approximately $2.7 billion. Under the terms of the agreement, shareholders of AmTrust will receive $13.50 in cash for each share of AmTrust common stock.
If you own common stock of AmTrust and purchased any shares before March 1, 2018, if you would like to learn more about this investigation, or if you have any questions concerning this announcement or your rights or interests, please contact Seth D. Rigrodsky or Gina M. Serra at Rigrodsky & Long, P.A., 300 Delaware Avenue, Suite 1220, Wilmington, Delaware 19801, by telephone at (888) 969-4242, or by e-mail at info@rl-legal.com .
Rigrodsky & Long, P.A. , with offices in Wilmington, Delaware and Garden City, New York, regularly prosecutes securities fraud, shareholder corporate, and shareholder derivative litigation on behalf of shareholders in state and federal courts throughout the United States.
